Dear Amy Elizabeth Harding:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
6/30/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
(6) Service plans shall be signed by the social services
worker and the social services supervisor.
Two of the eight current foster child records reviewed contained at least one
updated service plan that did not have the required signatures loaded into the
system. The first record had updated service plans completed 7/20/22, 9/13/22,
12/14/22, and 3/13/23 that did not have the required signatures. The second record
had an updated service plan completed 4/12/23 that did not have the required
signatures loaded in the system. A total of 24 service plans were reviewed to
determine compliance/noncompliance.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for
each child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal
and at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
Three of the eight current foster child records reviewed had at least one updated
service plan that was completed outside the time frame required by this rule. The
first example had a report period ending date of 3/24/23 that was completed
2

4/10/23. The second example had a report period ending date of 11/14/22 that was
completed 12/6/22. The third example had a report period ending date of 11/10/22
that was completed 11/28/22. A total of 24 foster child service plans were reviewed
for compliance/noncompliance.
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
(1) An agency’s medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(f) The provision of a dental examination and any
treatment required for each child who is 4 years of age
and older, including both of the following:
(i) A dental examination within 12 months before
placement or a new dental examination shall be
completed not more than 90 calendar days after
placement.
One of the eight current foster child records reviewed indicated the youth did not
have a dental examination completed timely. In this example the youth should have
had an initial dental examination completed by 1/07/2023 and no dental examination
was located within the medical section of the youth's record. A total of eight foster
child records were reviewed as a part of this interim evaluation.
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(c) Provide a copy of the report to any social services
worker that has children placed in the home.
Three of the three special evaluation reports reviewed did not include
documentation the worker with children placed in the home received a copy of the
completed special evaluation report as required by this rule.
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
(7) If any violations are cited and there is a signed
corrective action plan, all social service workers who
have children placed in the home shall be notified there
is a corrective action plan and what is required of the
foster parent in that plan.
One of the three special evaluations reviewed required the establishment of a
corrective action plan. No documentation was located to indicate the worker with
3

children in the home was informed regarding the expectations of the corrective
action plan as required by this rule.
CPA Rule 400.12507 Medical/dental and mental health care
(1) An agency shall ensure that a youth in independent
living receives any needed medical, dental, and mental
health care as required in R 400.12413. Medical, dental,
and mental health care provided shall be documented in
the youth’s record.
One of the three independent living records reviewed indicated the youth should
have had an updated physical examination completed by 4/15/2023 and there was
no documentation in the youth's record that a physical examination had been
completed at the time of this review.
FOM 722-06 B Family Team Meeting
The DHS-1105, Family Team Meeting Report, must be
completed for every FTM.
Five of the eight foster child records and two of the three independent living youth
records reviewed had at least one Family Team Meeting (FTM) that did not have
adequate documentation (1105) of the meeting uploaded into the information
system. The first foster care record documented FTMs on 3/24/22, 6/2/22,
1/4/23,3/10/23, and 3/22/23 without corresponding 1105s. The second foster child
record documented FTMs on 6/26/22, 9/19/22, 12/20/22, and 3/24/23 without
corresponding 1105s. The third foster child record documented FTMs on 1/19/23,
4/05/23, and 6/13/23 without corresponding 1105s. The fourth foster child record
documented an FTM on 8/12/22 without a corresponding 1105. The fifth foster child
record did not document the completion of an FTM associated with the time period
of 3/11/23 to 6/8/23. The first independent living record documented FTMs on
5/8/23 and 2/2/23 without corresponding 1105s. The second independent living
record documented an FTM on 11/8/22 without a corresponding 1105.

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted a corrective action plan 4/26/2022 for the renewal
evaluation completed 4/06/2022. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of
that review were 327 (5)(d) and FOM 722-08 E. The CAP was approved
4/27/2022 and there were no areas of repeat noncompliance as a part of this
interim evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator's assessment included a review of the agency's progress
in implementing and completing the corrective action plan for the renewal
evaluation completed 4/6/2022. It also included a review of the agency's key
performance indicators.
Financial Overview
Compliant Last annual audit dated 9/30/2022 was completed by an independent
source. Review indicated adequate financial resources.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Child Welfare staff participated in the entrance conference and interviews were
positive with no concerns noted.
Analyst interviews were positive in nature and indicated appropriate support and
services are being provided.
Description of Agency Walk Through
Building was well maintained and records were in locked areas as required for
compliance.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The analyst identified one safety alert for a licensed foster home involving a pellet
burning stove that did not have an adequate barrier. The alert was resolved
11/07/2022 when a gate was installed and picture documentation confirmed
5

compliance. Interviews were generally positive and indicated appropriate support
and services are being provided to youth, families, and caregivers.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
